Contradicts fact: The claim contradicts the fact that great white sharks cannot survive in freshwater.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or credible sources to verify the existence of a 3,000-pound great white shark in the Great Lakes.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the story is true without sufficient evidence or verification.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim can be explained as a fake news story or satire, as indicated by the disclaimer on the website where it was published.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times because it relies on false information and lacks credibility.
Fails to provide enough support: The claim fails to provide enough support because it is based on fabricated information and lacks factual evidence.
